name: Jeeeun Kim
content: Jeeeun Kim Jeeeun Kim [Google Scholar] [CV] Assistant Professor Computer Science & Engineering, Texas A&M University Director of HCIed (HCI Engineering & Design) Lab Founding organizer of TxHCI Seminar Series Faculty advisor of Aggie Women in Computer Science (AWICS) Student Organization If you are interested in working with me, please complete this form, then email me! Latest News 06/25   FABRIC is accepted to IROS'25 05/25   Instance Detection in Open World is accepted to CVPR'25 05/25   LumosX is presented at CHI'25 03/25   Honored to be named a TEES Young Faculty Fellow by the College of Engineering 09/24   Honored to be named a Montague-Center for Teaching Excellence Scholar 04/24   Thrilled to receive the NSF CAREER Award! 04/24   Serving a general co-chair with Ian Oakley for UIST'25 03/24   Serving a subcommittee chair (Devices, Materials, and Fabrication) for CHI'25 01/24   AccessLens, MorphMag, and Sustainable Unmaking (workshop) are accepted to CHI'24 01/24   Excited to be part of the NSF NRI project as a Co-PI 01/23   Serving a Doctoral Consortium co-chair for UIST'24 09/23   Excited to be part of the NSF FW-HTF-RM project as a Co-PI 09/23   3DPFIX is accepted to CSCW'24 for the first time! 09/23   HighRes Instance Detection Dataset is accepted to NeurIPS'23 for the first time! 09/23   Resuming the TxHCI Seminar Series 07/23   E3D is accepted to Ubicomp'23 for the first time! 05/23   Serving a subcommittee chair (Devices, Materials, and Fabrication) for CHI'24 01/23   Measurement Patterns is accepted to CHI'23 01/23   One paper accepted by Composite Sturcture (Elsevier) 07/22   Received two NSF Grants, HCC and FW-HTF-P as a PI 07/22   ShrinkCells is accepted to UIST'22 05/22   Serving on the program committee for CHI'23 03/22   CustomizAR is accepted to DIS'22 01/22   Two papers, One panel, and One LBW paper is accpeted to CHI'22 01/22   Serving on the program committee for UIST'22 11/21   Organizing 4D Printing Workshop for K-12 students 10/21   Happy to be part of founding member of VIVID Lab, Texas A&M Institute of Data Science!
